business_context: Board and executive leadership need to understand membership growth patterns over time to assess organizational health, marketing effectiveness, and strategic planning.
prompt: Show membership growth over the past 5 years

data_assertions.description: Should have data points for the past 5 years (yearly, quarterly, or monthly)
Current total should match actual member count

visualization.reasoning: Trend over time is best visualized with line or area chart showing progression

interactivity.expected_result: Show exact member count and date
Show members who joined in that time period

sample_sql:
-- Membership growth by year
SELECT 
  YEAR(m.JoinDate) as Year,
  COUNT(*) as NewMembers,
  SUM(COUNT(*)) OVER (ORDER BY YEAR(m.JoinDate)) as CumulativeMembers
FROM membership.Member m
WHERE m.JoinDate >= DATEADD(YEAR, -5, GETDATE())
GROUP BY YEAR(m.JoinDate)
ORDER BY YEAR(m.JoinDate);
human_eval_guidance: Verify the chart shows a clear upward trend. Check that time periods are evenly spaced and labeled. Confirm the final data point matches current member count.
common_pitfalls: Showing only new members per period instead of cumulative growth; using inappropriate chart type (pie/bar); not handling date ranges correctly; missing data for recent time periods.
